meanings.definition: The quality or state of being regular.
meanings.sent1: The teacher noticed the regularities in the student's daily routine.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the regularities in the pattern of the stars.
meanings.sent3: The regularities in the clock's ticking made it seem like it had a secret to tell.
meanings.sent4: The regularities in the waves crashing against the shore were like nature's heartbeat.
meanings.sent5: The regularities in the seasons changing reminded her of the cycle of life.

meanings.sent1: The birds flying south for the winter were a regularities in the fall.
meanings.sent2: The daily commute became one of the regularities of his life.
meanings.sent3: The regularities of the ice cream truck's visits always brought joy to the neighborhood.
meanings.sent4: The regularities of the train schedule kept everyone on time.
meanings.sent5: The regularities of the sun rising and setting were comforting in their predictability.
